body_html:
Can you try adding the following line, before starting the queue runners:

sess.run(tf.initialize_local_variables())

(It looks like there was a breaking change between 0.9 and 0.10, which recast how the auxiliary variables inside functions like tf.train.input_producer() are initialized.)
body_text:
Can you try adding the following line, before starting the queue runners:
sess.run(tf.initialize_local_variables())
(It looks like there was a breaking change between 0.9 and 0.10, which recast how the auxiliary variables inside functions like tf.train.input_producer() are initialized.)
body:
Can you try adding the following line, before starting the queue runners:

``` python
sess.run(tf.initialize_local_variables())
```

(It looks like there was a breaking change between 0.9 and 0.10, which recast how the auxiliary variables inside functions like `tf.train.input_producer()` are initialized.)
